Context:
Program Information:
- Name: Customer Relationship Marketing and Customer Experience
- Duration: Not specified in the text
- Key Areas Covered: database marketing strategy, customer relationship management tools, customer relationship marketing theory, customer experience foundations, loyalty marketing, marketing research, marketing automation tools for personalized customer journeys, marketing analytics and measurement.
- Capstone Project: Based on a real business situation
- Industry-Standard Software: cloud-based software (specific type not mentioned)

Hardware Requirements:
- Minimum Computing Requirements: PC with Intel i3 processor and Microsoft Windows 7 or higher, macOS High Sierra with Intel i3 processor and 4GB RAM.
- Web Camera and Microphone: Required
- Wi-Fi Compatibility: IEEE 802.11 a/b/g/n/ac
- Software Requirements: Microsoft Office for Windows (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, OneNote, OneDrive) and Microsoft Office for Mac (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, OneNote, OneDrive)

Field Education:
- Work Experience: Required after the end of the second academic semester. Can be co-op (paid) or internship (unpaid). Students apply for opportunities through George Brown College and are encouraged to pursue self-directed industry work experience.

Context:
The Centre for Business at George Brown College offers field education and marketing students have access to membership in two Canadian marketing associations, the CMA and IAB, as part of their tuition fees.

CMA Membership benefits include: live and online events with member pricing, professional development opportunities, resources and guides, networking opportunities, and exclusive access to CMA NXT.

IAB Membership benefits include: student volunteer opportunities for marquee events, members-only webinars and podcasts, original Canadian digital marketing research, globally accepted digital ad standards, standardized courses, certification, and custom workshops.

Graduates will be prepared for careers in various sectors such as hospitality, telecommunications and media, not-for-profit, retail, financial services, digital agencies, and advertising agencies. Potential positions may include marketing coordinator, CRM data analyst, automated campaign specialist, CRM marketing specialist, market research analyst, loyalty marketing coordinator, lead generation specialist, customer experience specialist, business analyst, and sales enablement specialist.

The Strategic Relationship Marketing program at George Brown College aligns with in-demand skills in sales and marketing such as customer relationship management (CRM), Salesforce, and Google Analytics. Students can also prepare for Randstad's suggested top in-demand sales and marketing certifications including Salesforce certification, Google Analytics certification, and HubSpot marketing software certification.

To graduate from the B409 program, students need to complete 13 mandatory courses and 1 work experience term. The required first semester course is COMP 1192 - Computer Applications for Database Marketing.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Strategic Relationship Marketing Program (Postgraduate) B409 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
The text provides information on various courses offered in Semester 1 and Semester 2 of a marketing program at the college. Here's the extracted information:

Semesters: 2

Courses in Semester 1:
- COMP 1192 (Computer Applications for Database Marketing): No prerequisite
- MARK 4013 (Customer Experience Fundamentals): No prerequisite
- MARK 4005 (Applied Business Communications): No prerequisite
- MARK 4015 (CRM Tools & Technology): No prerequisite
- BUS 4000 (Work Experience Prep Course): No prerequisite

Courses in Semester 2:
- MARK 4026 (Marketing Automation): Prerequisite is MARK 4015
- MARK 2040 (Strategic Project): Successful completion of Semester 1 required
- MARK 4007 (Marketing Research): No prerequisite
- MARK 4027 (Retention & Loyalty Marketing): No prerequisite
- MARK 4032 (Strategic Relationship Marketing Seminar Series): No prerequisite
- MARK 4033 (Customer Journey Analytics): Prerequisite is COMP 1192

Work Experience Term:
- COOP 4004 / INTN 4004 / BAWT 4004: No prerequisite

Additional information:
- The graduate will be able to create a professional marketing plan, develop a CRM marketing plan, apply strategic communication planning processes and tools, evaluate data from marketing technology platforms, apply CRM and CX best practices, design customer experience journey mapping, apply industry standard marketing analytics and CRM platforms, gather and analyze marketing research, communicate complex marketing material verbally, in writing and digitally, and model professional standards.
- Tuition and fees are not provided in the text.

Context:
Program-related information:
- This text mentions a program that includes one work experience semester.
- The tuition fee for the program does not include the cost of the work experience semester.
- The Work Experience fee is $500 and covers the cost of the Work Experience Preparation course and work experience semester.
- The program has different tuition fees for domestic and international students:
  - Domestic Tuition: $4,584.00 for programs starting in Fall 2022 and subject to change for later dates.
  - International Tuition: $17,929.00 for programs starting in Fall 2023 and subject to change for later dates.
- The text mentions that financial assistance is available for this program through OSAP, but it's subject to applicant meeting eligibility criteria.
- Admission requirements include a college advanced diploma, bachelor's degree or relevant work experience with resume and references required.
- International students need to provide English language proficiency test results or take the George Brown College English assessment for admission.
- Some college and university credits may qualify for exemptions and applicants can check the transfer guide for more information.
- International students should visit the International Admissions page for country-specific admission requirements.
- Domestic students should apply through Ontario Colleges and international students should follow the instructions on the How to Apply page.

Note: The text mentions that the information is subject to change without notice, so it's important to check the official college website for the most up-to-date information.

Context: The program "Strategic Relationship Marketing" is offered at George Brown's School of Marketing. The classes for this program usually take place at the St. James Campus, specifically at 200 King St. E. and 290 Adelaide St. E., Toronto, Ontario, Canada. Campus tours are offered regularly, and virtual tours are also available. Related programs include Marketing Management – Digital Media (Postgraduate) (B433), Marketing Management – Financial Services (Postgraduate) (B406), and International Business Management (Postgraduate) (B411). Riddhi Modi graduated from George Brown College with an Ontario College Graduate Certificate in Strategic Relationship Marketing. She found on-campus and off-campus opportunities at the college to develop industry relationships, leading her to do a co-op in the Marketing department and ultimately securing a full-time job in marketing.
